cultural_significance: Infamous as the world's deadliest mushroom, featuring prominently in historical poisonings and murder mysteries. A symbol of nature's hidden dangers.

historical_timeline.event: Death of Pope Clement VII attributed to mushrooms
Featured in numerous crime novels and films

historical_significance: The death cap has shaped mycological awareness more than any other species. Its lethal reputation has driven centuries of mushroom identification education.
folklore: In medieval Europe, unexplained deaths from 'bad mushrooms' were often attributed to witchcraft. The death cap's delayed symptom onset made poisoners difficult to identify.

literary_reference.author: Agatha Christie
literary_reference.title: The Pale Horse
literary_reference.quote: Features death cap poisoning as plot element

safety_education_impact: Primary driver of 'when in doubt, throw it out' foraging education worldwide
